pathAssistantSteps.info:
This stage means that the products have been implemented, tested and put into Billing.


This stage can only be entered into by the Sales Operations, Revenue Assurance, or Service Delivery.


Remember to edit all SID stages and Actual Bill Dates on your opportunity products before moving to billed.

This stage is to be used if the Opportunity is Lost for any reason.


This does not represent a disconnection.


The "Lost Reason" field is required once this stage is chosen.


An Opportunity should not move from this stage to any other stage.

This stage represents the Closure of the Sale.


The Opportunity Owner will not be able to edit certain fields on the Opportunity after it has been Closed Won e.g. you cannot move the stage backwards.


Actions Required:

  1. Ensure the contract is attached to opportunity

This is the third stage in the Opportunity Sales Cycle. At this stage, the owner will submit for approval, and depending on the TCV, the opportunity will be routed to the owner's manager or group bid governance for review.


Actions Required:

  1. Review any documents obtained from PreSales or attach the proposal.
  2. Submit for Approval (must have a file attached).


System Automation:

  • If approved, the stage moves forward to Proposal Review.
  • If rejected, the stage moves back to Prospecting & Qualification.

This is the fifth stage in the Opportunity sales cycle. This represents verbal agreement to the proposal. The Opportunity Owner should prepare and send the Order Forms / Contracts to the client and await the return of the signed documents.


Actions Required:

  1. Attach contract to opportunity ensuring that the word 'signed' is included in the file name.
  2. Fill out 'Contract Start Date' and 'Contract Term'
  3. Submit for approval


System Automation:

  • If approved, the stage moves to Closed Won

This is the fourth stage in the Opportunity sales cycle.


This stage represents the phase in which the Opportunity Owner has submitted the Proposal or Quote to the client and the phase in which the Opportunity Owner and the client are discussing document and/or the quotation provided.

This is the first stage in the Opportunity sales cycle. This stage represents the initial assessment of the client's needs and the identification of a possible solution for the client.


Actions Required:

  1. Add a product.
  2. Do you need a Pre-Sales Request?

Yes - Create one and the stage will automatically move to Solution Design!

No -

  1. Attach a file
    1. Move the stage to Commercial Review

This is the second stage in the Opportunity sales cycle. The interaction between Sales and Pre Sales in this phase of the process should result in a finished Presentation or Proposal from the Engineer.


System Automation:

Once a Pre-Sales Request is marked as 'Complete', the stage automatically moves to Commercial Review.


*Notes:

  • It is no longer required to submit for approval at this stage.
  • This stage should only be entered if there is a pre-sales request, else move to Commercial review.
